data.title: Not impressed
data.text:
Went Friday evening for a birthday party celebration.
Ordered a sangria that had to return because of it's horrible taste.
The food took forever to served.
Not much of a variety of food choices to pick from, they were supposed to offer tapas but then told us that they ran out of tapas!
Beverages after 9pm are supposed to be 1/2 price but are still expensive.
Worse part, gratuity is imposed at 20%! And the waiter smelled like cigarettes!!!

data.title: Romeo's (the new Romeo's)
data.text: Used to come here for great pizza. What a surprise to me when we arrived to find a beautifully renovated, upscale contemporary restaurant. Overall I liked it, but the atmosphere was a little chaotic the night we dined (big party occurring). Our waiter was pulled from the big table, to us, to the other side of the restaurant. Still good though.

data.title: The big chill
data.text:
Dinner reservations 745 Saturday night .   Polite but fawning waiter took our order.  After 35 minutes in found the busboy ( the only employee that knew anything about restaurant service) and asked him to please bring bread . After 50 minutes I found the manager and told him the 2 pizzas and 2 pasta dishes we ordered still had not been served. 
The food was very average and the dinner was a bust as my son and his fiancee drove to wellington  to join us from Miami. 

Bad experience and bad attitude as the manager ignored the complaint .

data.title: Best Italian Delivery!
data.text: We had the chicken Marsela and a great arugala salad.  The food came quickly and was hot!!!  Actually better than if we picked it up!

data.title: Great experience!!!!
data.text: What can I say about this place but WOW!!!!! Great service and Great food!!! we will be back, thanks for being here.

data.title: Alfresco dining
data.text:
Great Italian food, great pizza great wines great service.. Casual dining
Catch a movie after in same plaza.

data.title: Friends Nite Out
data.text: We were a group of 10. We all ordered from the Sunset Menu: a four course menu with a free Bottle of wine (Choice of red or white) per 4 people.  The cost was inexpensive at $25 per person.

data.title: Very good-----sort of--
data.text: Four of us had dinner there with each having a 3 course prix fixe dinner.  The water was pleasant enough and the food was excellent.  The negative was that the small size of the portions left a bit to be desired.  The dessert was tiny.  Bottom line--- small portions good food.  Bill w/o tip $109.00 for four.

data.title: Very very Nice meal
data.text: Food is great as is service. The acoustics in the restaurant need a bit of help. We had a 25$ 3 course meal truly a great meal and value.

data.title: Never Ever Again
data.text:
I visited three times. Twice in June for dinner. Our waiter was rude and even nasty. We arrived at 6pm for the early bird dinner. The table we requested ( oval table) was empty but we were seated at a table for eight near the bar. After requesting that table several times we were seated. Then the waiter refused to allow us to order from the early bird menu because " the kitchen" would be angry at him" for placing the order close to the end of the special. After quite a argument the manager gave us a new waiter and we ordered. The food was good but the mood was not. 
Today I was there for a girls lunch out. My chicken parm sandwich was burnt. It tasted as if it was made yesterday and reheated. The waiter disappeared and I found knives and bread plates for our table. My friend ordered sangria with fruit which never came. She finally changed her order. I wanted a burger but they were out of meat!!! My horrible lunch was exchanged with a salad.  Never Again

data.title: Great Restaurant
data.text:
The four of us had a great evening with delicious food & great service. The portions were large -glazed pork chop, chicken Marsala and capricciosa pizza are strongly recommended. 
The decor of the restaurant impressive. The wait staff was very efficient, bringing extra bread, filling waters and smooth delivery of each course. The only change requested would be that entree plates are not removed until the entire party is finished. This was not done, leaving all feeling rushed. Overall, a great restaurant and we will be back.

data.title: Upscale Romeo's
data.text:
Everything has changed.  once a pizza place,  now am upscale restaurant opened for lunch & dinner.  Sunset menu offers 3 courses & desert with multiple choices in each category.  We ordered a variety of dishes and each was delicious.  be sure to try the orange arugula salad & burshetta were exquisite.  Happy Hour 11a.m -6 pm is half price on EVERY DRINK. Really. My entree was ravioli which was yum.  The pork chop was huge and delicious. Dessert choices on sunset menu are cannoli or tiramisu. 
What a delightful find for us. We'll be back to try the other choices. 
Service was impeccable. Anthony, our waiter was attentive, informative, and so helpful.  Too full to plan next visit,  but it will be soon.

data.title: Excellent Pizza
data.text: My friend and I entered for a late lunch.  The restaurant is located in the Market Place shopping center near the Movies of Wellington.  The lunch menu has many choices and is a real bargain.  A 12-inch specialty/Gourmet pizza was only $8.00 and cheese only would have been $5.00.  I ordered their Calabrese pizza which was a combination of meat and vegetable which was delicious.  I took two slices home.  I inquired what a Gnocchi was and the server brought a piece out to sample.  The service was very friendly and efficient.  The restaurant has a elegant and modern decoration which was very nice.  I need to return with my wife.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: Great food, great serves....fun friendly environment.   Amazing concept of staff helping each other instead of fighting over tables.  I strongly encourage everyone to eat here.

data.title: Never again
data.text: Ordered a antipasto salad and veggie pizza. All came ice cold. Their "antipasto" salad has a huge piece of cold fried eggplant 2 pieces of prosciutto about 10 pieces of Huge chunks of provolone and a little chopped tomatoes 1 artichoke piece and 1 olive  2 pieces of pepperoni ..oh yeah forgot the 2 pieces of stale bread and little bit of lettuce. All for only $14 wow what a deal..never ordering from them again. I'm Italian and that is Not an antipasto salad sorry. !! By the way we called and manager said it was detailed on his menu..guess what. .when you go on their website you cannot blow up their menu to actually read it so sorry I had to Google the menu and read another website with menu  on it and didn't say anything about a cold fried eggplant on it. Yuck !! I live local in wellington and this  place needs  to go back to a regular pizza place and stop with their new menu trying to impress everyone...I'm  Not impressed. .

data.title: I Could Hate This Place
data.text: I'm perpetually on a diet. My wife and daughter each ordered pizza. I got the fish with a side of self-righteousness. The fish was excellent. The pizza -- my wife gave me a taste -- was outstanding. While the toppings were just marvelous, the crust had top be about the best I've ever had, and I've had pizza in Rome, Florence, NoHo, etc. Not believing my taste buds, I put them to the test by trying another taste; actually a slice. And then a tad of another because it would be so wrong to not finish this round mound of deliciousness. Thus the headline. Wow. We sat outside; delightful, even though it rained; covered. And the waiter we had -- a newbie -- could perhaps have been more efficient, friendly, professional, and engaging...but I don't know how. He was kind of the Romeo's pizza of servers!

data.title: Always a good experience
data.text: We are very lucky to have this place near by. The food spectacular I have never been disappoint with any of the menu choices that I have tried. Service class A, they take care of every single customer. Environment is top A too a little bit noise on busy nights.

data.title: When pizza place goes fancy
data.text:
This place was a great pizza joint! They still have great pizza but they have gone fancy. The menu is still a pizza joint but the prices are way too high now!  The atmosphere is great but doesn't match the pizza joint menu??? They charge fine dining prices but you get pizza joint food. The wine list is not good and way over priced. 

My advise be a fine dining place and upgrade your food and wine or go back to being awesome pizza at a reasonable price.

data.title: Family Sunday restaurant
data.text: Love there pizzas especially margarita. Great service and they take literally 30 to 45 minutes to get your order done. Highly recommend them

data.title: Don't bother ordering pizza delivery from here!
data.text: This review is based on pizza delivery only. The first time we ordered, the pizza was fabulous. The pizza was hot and flavorful with tons of toppings. We fell in love instantly. The 3 times afterwards it was the exact opposite... cold, mediocre and very few toppings. Next time I'll probably just order from Pizza Hut for half the price.
